cause.description:
The Children's Heart Project identifies children with life-threatening heart disease in countries that lack technology and training, and matches them with North American hospitals and surgeons that donate their time and services.
Fifty-one hospitals in 28 states and Canada have provided heart care for children from Mongolia, Honduras, Kosova, Bosnia, Uganda, and Nigeria.
1. To identify children with life-threatening heart disease in countries that lack technology and training, and match them with North American hospitals and surgeons that donate their time and services.
2. To help heal young bodies while providing an opportunity to share the Gospel of Christ with the children and their families back home.
3. To provide state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and training for doctors overseas.
cause.mission: To provide spiritual and physical aid to hurting people around the world.
cause.name: Children's Heart Project
